description: From un- +‎ goodly (adjective via Middle English ungoodly). Compare obsolete Dutch ongoedelike.

adjectives.description: ungoodly (comparative more ungoodly, superlative most ungoodly)

adverbs.description: ungoodly (comparative more ungoodly, superlative most ungoodly)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Badly; in a rough or improper manner. [14th–16th c.]
